html: Jehovah’s elect celebrate his lordship as the millennial age begins, acknowledging him alone as “our God”—their covenant Lord. From his manifesting himself to them in response to their invoking his name (vv 7-9; Isaiah 41:25; 52:6; 56:6), they know him personally. The oppressive “lords” who had hitherto ruled them, on the other hand, are dead, powerless to “live” or “regenerate” (yihiyu ); “spirits” or “ghosts” (repa’im ) unable to “rise up” or “resurrect” (yaqumu ) from the dead. Appointed to destruction, they and the memory of them are wiped out as if they had never existed (Isaiah 14:20).
